search_results.snippet:
The link sometimes called a Gunter's link, is a unit of length formerly used in 
many English-speaking countries. A link is exactly 66100 of a foot, or exactly 
7.92 inches. The unit is based on Gunter's chain, a metal chain 66 feet long with 
100 links, that was formerly used in land surveying. ... One hundred links make a 
chain.
search_results.title: Link (unit) - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet:
A chain (ch) is a unit of length. It measures 66 feet, or 22 yards, or 100 links, or 4 
rods (20.1168 m). There are 10 chains in a furlong, and 80 chains in one statute 
mile. An acre is the area of 10 square chains (that is, an area of one chain by one 
furlong). The chain has been used for several centuries in Britain and in some 
other ... American surveyors sometimes used a longer chain of 100 feet (30.48 m)
,...
